title: Asset Forex News
text: Gold is finally showing some signs of life, reversing four consecutive daily declines, while the recovery seems to have met some resistance around the $3,330 mark per troy ounce on Tuesday. Fading optimism on the trade front and prudence ahead of the Fed’s interest rate decision and the release of Friday’s NFP lend some legs to the precious metal.

title: Asset Forex News
text: The Australian monthly Consumer Price Index is foreseen stable at 2.1%. Quarterly CPI inflation is expected to have modestly decreased in Q2. The Reserve Bank of Australia kept the OCR at 3.85% at its May meeting. The Australian Dollar is set to post lower lows vs its American rival.

title: Asset Forex News
text: Gold price looks to build on the previous day's modest gains as the US Dollar bulls pause for a breather ahead of the FOMC decision later this Wednesday. The cautious market mood offers support to the XAU/USD. The optimism led by the recent US trade deals with Japan and the EU could act as a headwind for the precious metal amid bets that the Fed will keep rates higher for longer.
